reason.tex:
%text The value of $\int_{0.5}^2 \log x\cdot dx$ \underline\text{might not} be the same as the area under the curve Note that $\log x < 0$ for $x < 1$. Therefore % \begin{align} \begin{tabular}{NNN}
\hline \text{Range} & f(x)\cdot dx & \int_a^b f(x)\cdot dx \\ \hline 0.5\to 1 & < 0 & < 0 \\ \hline 1\to 2 & >0 & > 0 \\ \hline \end{tabular} \end{align} %text We want the \underline\text{total area} under the curve -- not the net area. Hence, \[ \quad A = \left\vert \intga \log x\cdot dx\right\vert + \intgb \log x\cdot dx \] %
